div.a: How To Win Any Climate Change Argument

div.div: Here's a handy flowchart for debating with climate change denialists.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XGcATA&via=Digg&text=How To Win Any Climate Change Argument

div.div: SWEDEN AND THE UK ARE ON THIS LIST

div.a: Why Is It So Hard To Identify The World's Rape Capital?

div.div: How it's possible for Botswana and Sweden to top a global ranking of rape.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12nsHec&via=Digg&text=Why Is It So Hard To Identify The World's Rape Capital?

div.div: DOES NOT HAVE A CTRL+ALT+DEL FOR LIFE

div.a: Inside Microsoft's House Of The Future

div.div: Here's a first look at Microsoft's revamped Space of the Future at its headquarters in Redmond, Washington. The facility is used to portray what the firm thinks life might be like five to 10 years in the future.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VrKU6j&via=Digg&text=Inside Microsoft's House Of The Future

div.div: SITS AROUND IN A ROBE ALL DAY

div.a: What Does The Pope Do, Anyway?

div.div: As the Catholic Church's cardinals gather in Rome to set a date for the selection of a new pope, there is no clear front-runner for the job. But one thing is for sure: The next pontiff will have a grueling schedule.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/106lFZR&via=Digg&text=What Does The Pope Do, Anyway?

div.a: Because Of Steve Jobs' First Public iPhone Call, Starbucks Still Gets Orders For 4,000 Lattes

div.div: The first call ever made to the outside world on an iPhone was obviously a prank call.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WDcV75&via=Digg&text=Because Of Steve Jobs' First Public iPhone Call, Starbucks Still Gets Orders For 4,000 Lattes

div.a: Brooklyn's Most Insane New Buildings Look Like Giant Angular Donuts

div.div: Welcome to Brooklyn, where you can live in a giant condo with a hole in it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WIk1gd&via=Digg&text=Brooklyn's Most Insane New Buildings Look Like Giant Angular Donuts

div.a: The Great South Bronx Beer Heist

div.div: If you're a drinker, odds are there's been a time when you've walked past a beer truck or wareshouse and idly considered how hard it would be to steal some. These guys actually did it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13CgORs&via=Digg&text=The Great South Bronx Beer Heist

div.div: SH*T IS FINALLY GOOD FOR SOMETHING

div.a: Astronaut Poop Will Be Used As A Radiation Shield On A Trip To Mars

div.div: A member of the Inspiration Mars planning team, says that human waste makes great radiation shielding, so it’ll be stuffed into bags and then lined along the walls of the ship.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z3UP1P&via=Digg&text=Astronaut Poop Will Be Used As A Radiation Shield On A Trip To Mars

div.a: The Science Of Sleeplessness

div.div: Some people can’t go to sleep until late; others can’t sleep in. Both suffer “social jet lag.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14kt1G1&via=Digg&text=The Science Of Sleeplessness

div.a: How Future Cameras Will Be Able To See In The Dark

div.div: Canon's showing off a full-frame sensor that can see stars and turn moonlight into daylight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/104zcB6&via=Digg&text=How Future Cameras Will Be Able To See In The Dark

div.a: Samsung Apologizes For Acid Fatality At Plant

div.div: In a rare move Samsung Electronics has issued a public apology for a gas leak at one of its plants in January that led to the death of one worker and hurt four others.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VtEDHe&via=Digg&text=Samsung Apologizes For Acid Fatality At Plant

div.a: Why Horse Meat Is Delicious

div.div: I’m just going to come out and say it: I love horsemeat. It’s lean, yet tender, it is flavorful but not gamy; it’s delicious. Those IKEA meatball-eaters have no idea how lucky they are.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XDlYHJ&via=Digg&text=Why Horse Meat Is Delicious

div.a: Behind The Doors Of The Senate Gym

div.div: Behind a discreet set of keypad-entry double doors on the first floor of the Russell Senate Office Building lies one of the last oases of what was once the world’s greatest good-old-boys club: the Senate’s members-only gym.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13z0pg2&via=Digg&text=Behind The Doors Of The Senate Gym

div.div: FIRST THE BIG GULPS, NOW THIS

div.a: The Meanest PSA Ever?

div.div: New York City is out with a new teen pregnancy prevention campaign and, like many of Mayor Michael Bloomberg’s public health initiatives, its a tad controversial.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12oF61z&via=Digg&text=The Meanest PSA Ever?

div.a: Iran Deploys Sniper Teams To Battle 'Mutant Rats'

div.div: For the first time, snipers have deployed in Tehran to combat a plague of "mutant" rats that are increasingly resistant to poison and have grown so big that cats are scared of them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YXakZw&via=Digg&text=Iran Deploys Sniper Teams To Battle 'Mutant Rats'

div.a: Smithsonian Magazine's 2012 Photo Contest Finalists Are Predictably Great

div.div: The editors of Smithsonian magazine have just announced the 50 finalists in their 10th annual photo contest.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y92W97&via=Digg&text=Smithsonian Magazine's 2012 Photo Contest Finalists Are Predictably Great

div.a: How Far Could A Drug Cannon Shoot?

div.div: So, apparently some drug smugglers decided not to smuggle drugs but instead shoot them over the border. OK, drug smuggling is not a good thing, but this is an awesome idea. So how far can one of these things fling drugs?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12oB6Ov&via=Digg&text=How Far Could A Drug Cannon Shoot?

div.div: IF A BAND PLAYS IN A GHOST TOWN...

div.a: How One Band Turned A Ghost Town Into A Giant Recording Studio

div.div: In August of 2011, the three members of the Danish band Efterklang, dressed in survival suits, loaded a small recording studio worth of equipment onto an open boat docked on the island of Spitsbergen. In front of them: nine days in the cold, no human contact outside their small party and the threat of polar bear attacks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XRc0jQ&via=Digg&text=How One Band Turned A Ghost Town Into A Giant Recording Studio

div.a: Why Some Places Are Even More Crowded Than We Thought

div.div: The most densely populated places on Earth become even more dense when you account for empty space.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WDHARJ&via=Digg&text=Why Some Places Are Even More Crowded Than We Thought

div.a: Before 'The Simpsons,' Matt Groening Did A Bunch Of Artwork For Apple

div.div: You may know that Matt Groening once illustrated a brochure for Apple back in 1989. However, in addition to that brochure, Groening did a bunch of other artwork for the company as well.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13A2Ejl&via=Digg&text=Before 'The Simpsons,' Matt Groening Did A Bunch Of Artwork For Apple

div.a: White House: It's Time To Legalize Cell Phone Unlocking

div.div: The White House on Monday came out in support of a consumer’s right to unlock their cell phone once they have fulfilled the terms of the contract.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WE0yrm&via=Digg&text=White House: It's Time To Legalize Cell Phone Unlocking

div.div: SOMEWHAT LIKE THE HISTORY OF WAR

div.a: The Future Of War

div.div: The world's top military thinkers on everything from cyberwar to shrinking budgets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wrcylp&via=Digg&text=The Future Of War

div.a: Is This The Greatest Cover For 'Farenheit 451' You've Ever Seen?

div.div: According to designer Elizabeth Perez, "The book's spine is screen-printed with a matchbook striking paper surface, so the book itself can be burned."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WGXIYm&via=Digg&text=Is This The Greatest Cover For 'Farenheit 451' You've Ever Seen?

div.a: The Crime Of His Childhood

div.div: On an October afternoon 40 years ago, on a beautiful block in Park Slope, Brooklyn, a crime occurred in a split second that was as permanent as it was cruel. Grown-ups tried to make sense of it, even use it as a cautionary tale for their children, but in the end, many just put it out of their minds. How could they not? It was just too awful, its lessons too hard to fathom.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZRHXKW&via=Digg&text=The Crime Of His Childhood

div.a: Now Begin The Robot Wars

div.div: The era of drone wars is already upon us. The era of robot wars could be fast approaching.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/1019NIt&via=Digg&text=Now Begin The Robot Wars

div.div: HI, MY WEEK WILL BE BETTER THAN YOURS

div.a: What The Out-Of-Office Reply Really Means

div.div: We've all experienced it: you send an important email, expecting to wait at least hours for a reply, but immediately get a response. Uh-oh. It's the out-of-office reply, a complex and coded message which essentially says "screw you".

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WDcCcn&via=Digg&text=What The Out-Of-Office Reply Really Means

div.a: Swimming With Spacemen

div.div: NASA was faced with a problem: how on Earth do you simulate microgravity? So they built the largest pool in the world and went swimming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z9IOEO&via=Digg&text=Swimming With Spacemen

div.a: Famous People Who Served In The Armed Forces

div.div: Here are some celebrities you'd be surprised to find out served in the armed forces.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZhOhL2&via=Digg&text=Famous People Who Served In The Armed Forces

div.a: How Numbers Can Reveal Hidden Truths About Sports

div.div: Numbers are much better at showing the truth about sports than conventional wisdom.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VpPGkR&via=Digg&text=How Numbers Can Reveal Hidden Truths About Sports

div.div: THIS IS PAYBACK FOR PIZZA HUT

div.a: The Worst American Restaurants In Europe

div.div: Americans have been ruining foreign cuisines for years, but that doesn't mean Europe hasn't been doing the same thing to American cuisine.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WlfgZt&via=Digg&text=The Worst American Restaurants In Europe

div.a: Apple's Planned 'iWatch' Could Be More Profitable Than TV

div.div: While Tim Cook has dropped hints that Apple Inc. (AAPL) is hard at work on a television to drive the next era of growth, the company’s wristwatch-style device, still in development, may prove more profitable.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13zoiUQ&via=Digg&text=Apple's Planned 'iWatch' Could Be More Profitable Than TV
